data.title: No Greater Love Than This
data.meta_description: Look on Jesus, oh mankind; Behold what grief is His! In all creation we will find no greater love than this.
data.text:
He bore a crown of plaited thorn, the mockery of men

A heavy cross, a heavy heart, a heavy load of sin

To recompense our mortal debt, to heal and make us whole

Upon the cross at Calvary He offered up his soul

Look on Jesus, oh mankind

Behold what grief is His!

In all creation we will find

No greater love than this

He said, “The Son of Man hath not a place to lay his head,”

And even in death ’twas in a borrowed tomb the Lord was laid

His body bearing bitter wounds in hands and feet and side

Anointed and prepared in haste against the falling night,

Look on Jesus, oh mankind,

What meager lot is His!

In all creation we will find

No greater love than this
